10  package de.funfried.netbeans.plugins.external.formatter.java.palantir;
11  
12  import java.util.Locale;
13  import java.util.SortedSet;
14  import java.util.TreeSet;
15  
16  import org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair;
17  import org.junit.Assert;
18  import org.junit.BeforeClass;
19  import org.junit.Test;
20  
21  /**
22   *
23   * @author bahlef
24   */
25  public class PalantirJavaFormatterWrapperTest {
26  	private static PalantirJavaFormatterWrapper instance;
27  
28  	@BeforeClass
29  	public static void setUpClass() {
30  		Locale.setDefault(Locale.ENGLISH);
31  
32  		instance = new PalantirJavaFormatterWrapper();
33  	}
34  
35  	@Test
36  	public void testFormatEnum() {
37  		final String text = "package foo;public enum Bar {A,B,C}";
38  		final String expected = "package foo;\n" +
39  				"\n" +
40  				"public enum Bar {\n" +
41  				"    A,\n" +
42  				"    B,\n" +
43  				"    C\n" +
44  				"}\n"
45  				+ "";
46  
47  		String actual = instance.format(text, null);
48  		Assert.assertEquals("Formatting should change the code", expected, actual);
49  	}
50  
51  	@Test
52  	public void testFormatEnumWithDifferentLineEndings() {
53  		final String text = "package foo;public enum Bar {\r"
54  				+ "A,\r"
55  				+ "B,\r"
56  				+ "C\r"
57  				+ "}";
58  		final String expected = "package foo;\r" +
59  				"\r" +
60  				"public enum Bar {\r" +
61  				"    A,\r" +
62  				"    B,\r" +
63  				"    C\r" +
64  				"}\r"
65  				+ "";
66  
67  		String actual = instance.format(text, null);
68  		Assert.assertEquals("Formatting should change the code", expected, actual);
69  	}
70  
71  	@Test
72  	public void testFormatClass() {
73  		final String text = "package foo; public class Bar {public void doSomething(String arg) { System.out.println(\"Hello World\"); }}";
74  		final String expected = "package foo;\n" +
75  				"\n" +
76  				"public class Bar {\n" +
77  				"    public void doSomething(String arg) {\n" +
78  				"        System.out.println(\"Hello World\");\n" +
79  				"    }\n" +
80  				"}\n" +
81  				"";
82  
83  		String actual = instance.format(text, null);
84  		Assert.assertEquals("Formatting should change the code", expected, actual);
85  	}
86  
87  	/**
88  	 * Currently failing: It seems there is a bug with character ranges in the Google Java Code Formatter
89  	 * https://github.com/google/google-java-format/issues/433
90  	 */
91  	@Test
92  	public void testPartlyFormatClass() {
93  		final String text = "package foo; public class Bar {\n" +
94  				"    @SuppressWarnings(\"unchecked\")\n" +
95  				"    // some comment      \n" +
96  				"    public void doSomething(String arg) { System.out.println(\"Hello World\"); } public boolean doSomethingElse(Object obj) { return false; } }";
97  		final String expected = "package foo;\n" +
98  				"\n" +
99  				"public class Bar {\n" +
100 				"  @SuppressWarnings(\"unchecked\")\n" +
101 				"    // some comment      \n" +
102 				"    public void doSomething(String arg) { System.out.println(\"Hello World\"); }\n" +
103 				"\n" +
104 				"    public boolean doSomethingElse(Object obj) {\n" +
105 				"        return false;\n" +
106 				"    }\n" +
107 				"}\n" +
108 				"";
109 
110 		SortedSet<Pair<Integer, Integer>> regions = new TreeSet<>();
111 		regions.add(Pair.of(0, 66));
112 		regions.add(Pair.of(171, 234));
113 
114 		String actual = instance.format(text, regions);
115 		//		Assert.assertEquals("Formatting should change the code", expected, actual);
116 		// This should be actually equal, if this test fails it means it has been fixed by the google-java-format team
117 		Assert.assertNotEquals("Formatting should change the code", expected, actual);
118 	}
119 
120 	@Test
121 	public void testPartlyFormatClass2() {
122 		final String text = "package foo; public class Bar {\n" +
123 				"	public void doSomething(String arg) {\n" +
124 				"		System.out.println(\"Hello World\");\n" +
125 				"	}\n" +
126 				"public boolean doSomethingElse(Object obj) { return false; } }";
127 		final String expected = "package foo;\n" +
128 				"\n" +
129 				"public class Bar {\n" +
130 				"	public void doSomething(String arg) {\n" +
131 				"		System.out.println(\"Hello World\");\n" +
132 				"	}\n" +
133 				"\n" +
134 				"    public boolean doSomethingElse(Object obj) {\n" +
135 				"        return false;\n" +
136 				"    }\n" +
137 				"}\n" +
138 				"";
139 
140 		SortedSet<Pair<Integer, Integer>> regions = new TreeSet<>();
141 		regions.add(Pair.of(0, 31));
142 		regions.add(Pair.of(111, 173));
143 
144 		String actual = instance.format(text, regions);
145 		Assert.assertEquals("Formatting should change the code", expected, actual);
146 	}
147 
148 	@Test
149 	public void testNullCode() {
150 		String actual = instance.format(null, null);
151 		Assert.assertNull("Formatting shouldn't change the code, should still be null", actual);
152 	}
153 
154 	@Test
155 	public void testNonFormatableCode() {
156 		final String text = "package foo;public Bar {A,B,C}";
157 
158 		try {
159 			instance.format(text, null);
160 		} catch (RuntimeException ex) {
161 			Assert.assertTrue(ex.getMessage(), ex.getMessage().contains("error: class, interface, "));
162 		}
163 	}
164 
165 	@Test
166 	public void testIllegalChangedElementsCode() {
167 		final String text = "package foo;public enum Bar {A,B,C}";
168 
169 		SortedSet<Pair<Integer, Integer>> regions = new TreeSet<>();
170 		regions.add(Pair.of(1200, 1230));
171 
172 		try {
173 			instance.format(text, regions);
174 		} catch (RuntimeException ex) {
175 			Assert.assertTrue(ex.getMessage(), ex.getMessage().contains("invalid length"));
176 		}
177 	}
178 }
